Sun, 25 Aug 2024 07:00:00 +0000 ESR surveillance shows weekly hospitalisations of people with severe acute respiratory illness (Sari) in Auckland are still tracking far higher than the 2015-19 average, as well as rates from the last two years.

Suspected drink-driver slams into patrol car, officers escape unscathed https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/suspected-drink-driver-slams-into-patrol-car-officers-escape-unscathed/ZW3ZXOEHTRFAHHMQU2NHUBF7XI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/suspected-drink-driver-slams-into-patrol-car-officers-escape-unscathed/ZW3ZXOEHTRFAHHMQU2NHUBF7XI/ A pair of police officers are shaken but unhurt after being hit by suspected drink-driver. Sun, 25 Aug 2024 05:23:05 +0000 A patrol car was travelling along Lower Hutt’s Waiwhetu Rd about 1am today when another vehicle crossed the centre line and crashed into the side of it, spinning it around and causing “extensive damage”, police said. Photo / NZ Police

Mangonui Waterfront Festival canned for 2025, organisers hope it can return in future with new impetus https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/hopes-far-norths-popular-mangonui-waterfront-festival-can-be-revived/5LHGHFFH3FE23HIQS6JKLNJ75E/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/hopes-far-norths-popular-mangonui-waterfront-festival-can-be-revived/5LHGHFFH3FE23HIQS6JKLNJ75E/ Mike DinsdaleWhat's behind the festival's cancellation is revealed but there's hope for the future.
